metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5064 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An exploitable heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the data structure persistence functionality of OpenCV, before version 4.2.0. A specially crafted JSON file can cause a buffer overflow, resulting in multiple heap corruptions and potentially code execution. An attacker can provide a specially crafted file to trigger this vulnerability.

notes.Note: ccdm94> upstream reports that versions 3.4.8 and older are not affected. See: https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues /15857.

criterions.comment: opencv: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
